post_text:
A BIG Thanks to all who helped choose the Red Ribbon Door Winners! Every door was so awesome and the work that the teachers and staff put into them is much appreciated!! The kids have really enjoyed them and hopefully have taken the messages to heart!‚ù§Ô∏è

‚Ä¢We had several local businesses that provided the winners with some special treats. We are so grateful to Tonya‚Äôs Restaurant, Nick‚Äôs Quick Check, Hometown Foods, Joyce‚Äôs Flowers, Southern Bank and Winningham Pharmacy.

***Winners***
Pre-K to 2nd grade: Pre-K Ms. Sceleta Garrett Ms. Mesha Sarrels and Ms. Meg Whitehurst

3rd-6th grade: Ms. Kayla Lock

7th-12th grade: Ms. Courtney Swiney

Special Services: Ms. Paula Boyce

Again, THANKS to all who participated in Red Ribbon Week!!

post_text:
The Parent Guide for Re-entry has been added to the Bradford School District website under the Parents tab.
Regarding questions about masks/face coverings, the District is not requiring any certain color of mask; however, students will be required to follow the student dress code policy.
The District has a responsibility to promote an environment conducive to student learning, so masks that are disruptive to the educational process will not be allowed.

We are excited to work together this year! If you have any questions, please call your child's principal at (501)344-8245 or (501)344-2607.

The Bradford Medical Clinic is blocking off August 6th in the afternoon for Sport Physicals. If you have symptoms of COVID you won‚Äôt be allowed into the clinic. If you have been tested at anytime for Covid they will need a copy of the results. If you were tested at Unity the clinic can pull those results in 2 minutes. You will need to come with the physical form the coaches gave you filled out and a parent signature if parent is not present.
TIMES:
1-2 pm 7th Grade
2-3 pm Jr. High
3-4 pm Sr. High

post_text:
Thank you for completing the online survey that indicates the type of learning environment that will best meet your child's needs at this time! Having this information is helping guide us as we continue to work on our re-entry plan. Our first day of school is Thursday, August 13th. We look forward to working with you and your child this school year! If you have not taken the survey, please do so by Friday, July 10th. Once our re-entry plan for the fall is finalized, we will share it. If you have any questions or concerns in the meantime, please call me at (501)344-2707. Again, thank you for your patience, understanding, and support!

-Mrs. Patti Stevens

***All the cheese has been distributed.

Attention: Pick up will begin at 10:15 this morning at the school auditorium!

The Arkansas Food Bank will deliver on Wednesday, June 24th. They have notified us that this delivery will be cheese only. This week we will only allow you to pick up for your family. We want to make sure that those in need are served. We will be posting the pick up time once we receive the items. We will post on this page and the Elementary page as well.

post_text: To our families in the Bradford School District: We are currently planning for our August 13th return for the 2020-2021 school year. Guidance from the State and Governor will continue to shape our committee decisions as we work to have a plan that will ensure the safety of our students and staff. We appreciate your patience and can't wait to see you back in the fall! We will update you more as our plans are finalized. Have a great rest of the summer!
text: To our families in the Bradford School District: We are currently planning for our August 13th return for the 2020-2021 school year. Guidance from the State and Governor will continue to shape our committee decisions as we work to have a plan that will ensure the safety of our students and staff. We appreciate your patience and can't wait to see you back in the fall! We will update you more as our plans are finalized. Have a great rest of the summer!

post_text:
üì¢Attention Bradford School District Parents and Community Membersüì¢
This Friday, June 12, from 2-4 there will be food boxes available to anyone that is in need of extra help during this difficult time. It is available to everyone, not just those with school age students. If you know of an elderly community member that would benefit please feel free to pick one up for them. It is going to have fresh produce among other items. We will not be able to hold a box for you because we can not store the cold food products. Please make arrangements to pick on Friday from 2-4 pm in the school cafeteria. If you have questions please reach out to Mrs. Tabitha Owens.

Please make arrangements to pick on Friday from 2-4 pm in the school cafeteria. If you have questions please reach out to Mrs. Tabitha Owens.

post_text: Bradford Yearbooks will be available for purchase ONLINE ONLY until either 4/20 or supplies run out, whichever comes first. There are only 50 copies left to buy. When they're gone, they're gone. If you waited to try to get an extra when they're handed out, now is the time to buy! Don't miss this LAST CHANCE to purchase a 2019-2020 yearbook! As of right now, yearbooks will be passed out when we return back to school. The link to go buy a book is www.jostensyearbooks.com. Email Mrs. Lesley Hollis at lhollis@bradford.k12.ar.us with any questions.

Bradford Yearbooks will be available for purchase ONLINE ONLY until either 4/20 or supplies run out, whichever comes first. There are only 50 copies left to buy. When they're gone, they're gone. If you waited to try to get an extra when they're handed out, now is the time to buy! Don't miss this LAST CHANCE to purchase a 2019-2020 yearbook! As of right now, yearbooks will be passed out when we return back to school. The link to go buy a book is www.jostensyearbooks.com. post_text: Bradford School District was made aware that some misinformation about the cancellation of graduation has been shared. Graduation has NOT been cancelled. We will adhere to all regulations set forth by the government and when those are lifted we will reevaluate at that time. We apologize for any confusion this may have caused.

post_text:
Notice: If you are registered for the April 4th ACT!

The safety of students and test center staff is ACT‚Äôs top priority. ACT has rescheduled its April 4th national test date to June 13th across the U.S. in response to concerns about the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19). All students registered for the April 4th test date will receive an email from ACT in the next few days informing them of the postponement and instructions for free rescheduling to June 13th or a future national test date.

*If you have questions concerning this you may email Mrs. Otts at sotts@bradford.k12.ar.us

After receiving direction from Governor Asa Hutchinson, Bradford School District will be utilizing Alternative Methods of Instruction (AMI) days for March 16-20. We will use AMI Days 3-7 during this time. Students were given packets at school on Friday. If you have questions concerning the work you may email your child‚Äôs teacher. Further updates will be posted to this page as necessary.
As of now school will resume on Monday, March 30th.

*If you have a physical at another clinic it must be AAA compliant.

post_text: ATTENTION PARENTS: A man has been trying to talk to young girls in our area on social media. We are informing you in hopes of prevention. The School's main concern is for the students' safety. We encourage you to discuss internet safety with your children. Keep in mind most kids have more than one social media account. (Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, etc.) We can never be too careful with our children's safety.
text: ATTENTION PARENTS: A man has been trying to talk to young girls in our area on social media. We are informing you in hopes of prevention. The School's main concern is for the students' safety. We encourage you to discuss internet safety with your children. Keep in mind most kids have more than one social media account. (Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, etc.) We can never be too careful with our children's safety.

post_text: Due to the weather report of possible ice or snow we will delay school starting until 9:00 a.m. Friday, January 12th. This will allow us to make sure roads are safe to travel and give bus drivers more daylight to run routes. If conditions are not favorable to have school, another notice will be sent.
